meanings.definition: A person who engages in sandbagging.
meanings.sent1: The sandbaggers worked together to protect the town from flooding.
meanings.sent2: The sandbaggers were praised for their quick response during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The sandbaggers joked that they were like human beavers, building dams to hold back the water.
meanings.sent4: The sandbaggers were like silent guardians, always ready to defend against the rising waters.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sandbaggers tirelessly filling bags will forever be etched in my mind.

meanings.sent1: She sandbaggers by strategically holding back her true abilities until the competition.
meanings.sent2: He sandbaggers by pretending to be a novice, then surprising everyone with his skill.
meanings.sent3: The cat sandbaggers by pretending to be asleep, then pouncing on the unsuspecting toy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds sandbaggers by hiding the sun, only to reveal a stunning sunset later.
meanings.sent5: The magician sandbaggers by distracting the audience, then performing an incredible trick.

meanings.sent1: The sandbaggers was necessary to prevent the river from overflowing.
meanings.sent2: After the heavy rain, the sandbaggers became a common sight along the riverbanks.
meanings.sent3: The sandbaggers at the beach competition made sure no one could build a higher sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The sandbaggers of the team helped secure their victory by slowing down the opponents.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sandbaggers being stacked echoed through the neighborhood as the storm approached.
